intro: Thapsia scabra, commonly known as the rough thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Thapsia scabra is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
